JUST - Output 5
independent political entity
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

While assisting the Government in achieving its priorities and in line with the CPD (2012-2016), UNDP Jamaica is strategically supporting the achievement of inclusive and transformational outcomes within its areas of comparative advantage
Provide targeted assistance to build GOJ capacity to deliver on selected national development priorities in line with the Vision 2030 Jamaica: National Development Plan.
Health - policy, planning and administration

1) Extent to which the National Strategy for Development Effectiveness developed (fully, partially, not developed) 2) Status of completion of National Consultative Workshops (fully, partially, not done) 3) Percentage of International Development Partners (IDP) in Jamaica consulted for validation 4) Number of International development cooperation summits Jamaica is represented 5) Percent of Implementing Partners assisted in monitoring through validation visits 6) Percentage of quarterly reports received by the CO by the requested deadlines 7) Number of IDP Project Staff trained on RBM 8) Percent of requests from GOJ for technical assistance in ME fulfilled 9) Percentage of GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated 10) % of participants submitting action plans on applying training for improvement of performance in their MDA 11) Number of initiatives to share knowledge and experience supported 12) Number of international conferences attended by govt officials 13) Number of relevant staff trained in Project Management 14) Percent of relevant entities represented at the high-level sensitization session 15) Number of project proposals developed for submission for funding that relate to government priorities 16) Number of stakeholder consultation sessions conducted that relate to government priorities 17) Number of forums organized to share knowledge and experience on resource mobilization 18) Percentage of proposals successful in securing funding

comment.narrative: 1) National Strategy for Development Effectiveness draft framework developed 2) No National Consultative Workshop for DE Strategy held 3) No International Development Partners (IDP) in Jamaica consulted for validation of Development Effectiveness Strategy 4) No representation at International development cooperation summits by Jamaica 5) No Implementing Partners assisted in monitoring through validation visits 6) 60% of quarterly reports received by the CO by the requested deadline 7) 40 IDP Project Staff trained on RBM 8) No requests from GOJ for technical assistance in ME fulfilled 9) No GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated 10) No participants submitting action plans on applying training for improvement of performance in their MDA 11) No forums share knowledge and experience held 12) No international conferences attended by govt officials 13) No relevant staff trained in Project Management 14) No entities represented at the high-level sensitization session 15) No proposals developed for submission for funding that relate to government priorities 16) No stakeholder consultation sessions conducted that relate to government priorities 17 No forums organized to share knowledge and experience on resource mobilization 18)No proposals successful in securing funding

Output 1.1 1. The National Strategy for Development Effectiveness completed 2. National Consultative Workshop completed 3. Minimum 80% of IDPs consulted 4. Jamaica is represented at 50% of International high level development cooperation meetings
Output 1.2 1. 100 % of Implementing Partners assisted in monitoring through validation visits 2. 80% of the quarterly report received by the CO before the deadline 3. 20 Project Staff trained on RBM 4. 80 % of requests from GOJ for technical assistance in ME fulfilled.
Output 1.3: GOJ officials in MDAs have specialised knowledge in strategic areas 1. 50% of GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated 2. One initiatives to share knowledge and experience supported 3. At least 1 GOJ official assisted to attend international conferences

Draft Development Effective Strategy for Jamaica has been developed. Its reviewed by both the government and UNDP and the comments communicated to the consultant for adjustment. National consultative workshop depends on the finalization of the Development Effective Strategy. Its a lesson learnt that validation visits all Implementation Partners is not a reality since the IPs as well as the CO have competing priorities throughout. Therefore, validation was performed to some extent for quality assurance in ME at regular bilateral meetings with IPs. As a result of bilateral meetings progress reporting showed improvements in timing and content. UNV ME expert deployed at the Planning Institute of Jamaica (PIOJ) to provide technical assistance to build capacity of the GOJ (Government of Jamaica) in terms of ME. UNV provided support to individual units of the PIOJ including Vision 2030 secretariat, Community Renewal Project and specifically to the External Cooperation Management Division (ECMD). Efforts made to enhanced knowledge and skills of PIOJ project staff in RBM. Draft ME framework for ECMD initiated. Justice Reform Implementation Unit (JRIU) of the Ministry of Justice was assisted to revise the Performance Measurement framework. The Parish Research Days of the Social Development Commission (SDC) was facilitated. The theme was: Research: The Building Block of Community Development which is a forum design to share and promote the usefulness of the data that is available at the parish level and to highlight the role and function of the Community Research and Database Programme. Parish Research Day envisages to look at community data and its impact in the development of communities and by extension, Jamaica. One government official from the Cabinet Office was facilitated to participate in the 4th International Conference on National Evaluation Capacities held in Thailand in October.

Output 1.1: National Strategy for Development Effectiveness in Jamaica developed 1. The National Strategy for Development Effectiveness completed 2. National Consultative Workshop completed
Output 1.2: Monitoring and evaluation capacity of the government and counterparts enhanced 1. 90% 2. 80% of the quarterly reports collected by the CO deadline 3. 80 persons 4. 80% of requests for TA fulfilled
Output 1.3: GOJ officials in Ministries, Department and Agencies (MDAs) have specialised knowledge in strategic areas 1. At least 50% of GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated. 2. Participation in two(2) international conferences per year
Output 1.4: Project Management skills of government and counterparts enhanced 1.Thirty five (35) related staff from government and counterparts trained on Project Management Skills 2.Eighty (80) % of relevant entities represented
Output 1.5: Capacity to localize Sustainable Development Goals within the framework of national development agenda strengthened 1. Min 2 forums per year 2. Agreed activities fully completed 3. Fully established 4. Online training developed 5. At least 1 per year
Output 2.1: CO pipeline of development solutions aligned to current and emerging national development challenges 1. Two project proposals developed for submission funding per year 2. Two sessions per year
Output 2.2: Resource mobilization capacity for consolidating the CO pipeline increased 1. At least 2 forums held to discuss and share knowledge and experience 2. 50% of the proposals secure funding

Output 1.1 The National Strategy for Development Effectiveness completed and validated with having conducted the National Consultative Workshop. Output 1.2 Enhancing Monitoring and evaluation capacity of the government and counterparts continued throughout the year; Both government and implementing partners provided with RBM support; A prototype Monitoring Framework for External Cooperation Management Division of Planning Institute of Jamaica was developed. Support provided to improve the ME framework of the Community Renewal Programme of government. 100% requests for ME support fulfilled. Output 1.3 GOJ officials in Ministries, Department and Agencies (MDAs) have specialised knowledge in strategic areas: Two officials were assisted to attend international training/conference/meetings. Output 1.4 Project Management skills training for government was not implemented since the alignment of the training to that of the Public Investment Management System. Output 1.5 Strengthening Capacity to localize Sustainable Development Goals within the framework of national development agenda continued. Social Good Summit to enhance youth participation in Technology innovation was held. Also the launch of the Caribbean CDR and the SDG conference were launched. Online training on Human Rights is being implemented. Output 2.2 Sustainability Plan to replicate Risk Reduction Management Centres at Parish level was developed for resource mobilization.

Output 1.1: Framework for Development Effectiveness in Jamaica strengthened 1.1.4: Two DE information sessions conducted 1.1.5: Sixty persons (50% female) attending DE sessions
Output 1.2: Monitoring and evaluation capacity of the government and counterparts enhanced 1.2.3: 110 persons provided with RBM training 1.2.5: 80% of IPs provided ME capacity building support
Output 1.3: GOJ officials in Ministries, Department and Agencies (MDAs) have specialised knowledge in strategic areas 1.3.1 At least 50% of GOJ requests for specialised training for officials facilitated. 1.3.2 2 knowledge sharing events of GOJ supported 1.3.3 2 international conferences are attended by GoJ officials
Output 1.5: Capacity to localize Sustainable Development Goals within the framework of national development agenda strengthened 1.5.1: At least one(1) SDG forum per year held 1.5.4: Human Rights training curriculum developed 1.5.5: One (1) GOJ staff facilitated to attend an international human rights event
Output 2.1: CO pipeline of development solutions aligned to current and emerging national development challenges 2.1.1. Two project proposals developed for submission to donors per year 2.1.2. Two stakeholder consultation sessions conducted per year
Output 2.2: Resource mobilization capacity for consolidating the CO pipeline increased 1. At least 2 visibility events fully or partially supported for resource mobilization

Output 1.1: Framework for Development Effectiveness in Jamaica strengthened Output 1.2: Monitoring and evaluation capacity of the government and counterparts enhanced Output 1.3: GOJ officials in Ministries, Department and Agencies (MDAs) have specialised knowledge in strategic areas Output 1.4: Project Management skills of government and counterparts enhanced Output 1.5: Capacity to localize Sustainable Development Goals within the framework of national development agenda strengthened
Outcome 2: Development options elaborated and available to effectively address current and emerging national development challenges Output 2.1: CO pipeline of development solutions aligned to current and emerging national development challenges Output 2.2: Resource mobilization capacity for consolidating the CO pipeline increased

title.narrative: Deployment of Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency

description.narrative: This project seeks to advance a low carbon development path and reduce Jamaicas public sector energy bill through the introduction of renewable energy (RE) and improvement in energy efficiency (EE) in the health sector.

title.narrative: DraftProDoc-Deployment of Renewable Energy and Improvement of Energy Efficiency Project

description.narrative: To build relevant capacity in the public sector by increasing the knowledge base of its operatives on matters pertinent to RE and EE as well as developing the appropriate technical skills necessary to support investments in the sector.
Energy - power generation
Reintegration and Rehabilitation of Involuntary Returned Migrants in Jamaica

The main objective of the project is to develop and strengthen the national and local system to enable an increase in the number of deported persons that have access to adequate social services, jobs and livelihood opportunities in Jamaica.
Anti corruption

title.narrative: Localizing the SDGs: Global Goals, Local Action

description.narrative: The project will support the development of a coordination mechanism for the implementation of the SDGS in Jamaica; foster awareness of the goals ; and improve data quality across MDAs involved in the production of the SDG indicators.
